result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter A Jorgensen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Court orders bond on file in the amount of $500 be applied. Cost are paid in full.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is not to possess any firearm during probation term. Defendant is to have NO CONFRONTATIONAL contact with the victim as named in the complaint.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed. Corut orders forfeiture and destruction of Sig Sauer P250 .45 semi automatic handgun and any live ammunition confiscated.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter A Jorgensen

defendant.name: Jorgensen, Peter A

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 10:46 am case called. Defendant Peter A Jorgensen in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing hearing. Right to Counsel reaffirmed and waived by defendant. Chapter 950 compliance. Court sentences the defendant to: Impose 5 months WCJ, STAYED and places the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months. If revoked, with Huber and Good Time Credit. No credit for Time Served. CONDITIONS:   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. AODA and follow through. No possession of firearm during probation term. No confrontational contact with victim as named in the complaint. Costs to include $42.50 blood draw fee to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed. Court orders forfeiture and destruction of Sig Sauer P250 .45 semi automatic handgun & live ammunition be destroyed.  Appeal Rights Given. Court orders bond to be applied.
Sentencing hearing on April 12, 2016 at 10:45 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Not to be in the possession of any firearms.

Case Called @ 2:02 PM: Defendant Peter A Jorgensen in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def does not wish counsel today and is willing to resolve the matter today.    Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea:  GP  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Per ADA:  Has rec'd a request from the victim to speak with the DA prior to sentencing.  Court will adjourn sentencing based uon that information rec'd.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 10:45 am.
